prompt:
Translate the following sentence from English to Fon
[English]: French electoral law rather strictly codifies the proceedings.
[Fon]:

src_text: Since 1988, ballot boxes must be transparent so that voters and observers can witness that no envelopes are present at the start of the vote and that no envelopes are added except those of the duly counted and authorized voters.

prompt:
Translate the following sentence from English to Fon
[English]: The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical.
[Fon]:

src_text: Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).
ref_text: Nǔ Vɛ Nu sin tɔn e yɔ ɖo Hydrogen ɔ nǔ nǔkun ma si mɔn ɖé wɛ bɔ nǔ vi tɔn lɛɛ ɔ nɔn yahu jo éɖo (ɖo Nǔ Vɛ Nu Hydrogen nǔ vi awhé jin wɛ ɖé mɛ).
hyp_text: Mè d’Hydrogen ions se se yon pòton ki te gen nan yo lè yo te tounen nan yo (se pòton ak yon eleman ki te gen nan yo) .
prompt:
Translate the following sentence from English to Fon
[English]: Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).
[Fon]:

src_text: In the 16th century Paraguay, formerly called "The Giant Province of the Indies", was born as a result of the encounter of Spanish conquerors with the native indigenous groups.

prompt:
Translate the following sentence from English to Fon
[English]: Generally speaking, there is no point in even looking for discounts for business or first-class seats on direct flights from A to B.
[Fon]:
